label: Bill of Sale to Sarah Marie Drayton for the purchase of five slaves, December 13, 1831
description: A bill of sale to Sarah Marie Drayton for the purchase of five slaves from the estate of Mrs. Ann D. Perry. James W. Gray, the commisioner of the Court of Equity facilitated the sale. The sale includes the guarantee to the purchaser of "the future issue of the Females"--meaning any future children will be the property of the purchaser. The  back of the document includes several worn statements regarding the legality of the sale.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
BILL OF SALE.

SOUTH-CAROLINA.

WHEREAS the Honorable COURT OF EQUITY, by their Decree made at
Charleston, during May sitting, eighteen hundred and thirty-one
did direct that certain Negroes, belonging to the Estate of Mrs
Ann D. Perry-
should be sold by the Commissioner of the said Court, on terms in said Decree specified,
all which will more particularly appear on reference to the Registry of the Court:
AND WHEREAS, at a sale of the said Negroes before me, as Commissioner in Equity, at
Charleston, on the Thirteenth day of December eighteen
hundred and thirty-one the Three- following Negro
Slaves named Chloe and her two children.
Agrissa and Sue were-

purchased by Miss Sarah Maria Drayton for the
sum of Eight hundred and twenty-five
Dollars-

NOW THEREFORE I, JAMES W. GRAY, as Commissioner of the said Court,
by virtue of the authority in me vested, under the Decree above-mentioned, and also for
and in consideration of the said sum of
Eight Hundred and twenty-five dollars
by the said Sarah Maria Drayton to me paid,
DO HEREBY bargain and sell unto the said Sarah Maria Drayton
the above three Negroes TO HAVE AND TO HOLD the said negroes
Chloe, Agrissa and Sue-

- together with the future issue of the Females

to the only proper use of the said Sarah Maria Drayton her
Executors, Administrators and Assigns.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my Hand and Seal, this 13th
day of December in the year of our Lord one thousand eight
hundred and thirty-one and of the American Republic the
fifty-sixth.

Signed, Sealed, and Delivered
in Presence of

[Robert Gilchrist?]
James W [Gray?]
Common Equity 

[End page 1]

Received the written [Consideration?] money
also Three dollars for the Bill of Sale, making
in all Eight hundred and forty-seven dollars 25/100
[through J.S. Grimke Esqr.]- 
JW Gray 
Com: in Eqy

825 [dollars] Price
19..25 [illegible] to 13 March 1832
3.- Bill Sale

847.25 [dollars]
[receipt?]

Robt. [Robert] Gilchrist
South Carolina

Robert B. Gilchrist being sworn
says he was present and saw James W Gray Comm [Commissioner]
in Equity Sign Seal and deliver the written Bill of
Sale In the uses and purpose therein mentioned
also saw him sign the above Recipt and that Deponent
subscribed his name as a Witness.-

Sworn before me
this 16th March 1832

Robt. [Robert] Gilchrist

Rob [Elfe?]
[illegible]

Secretary of States Office
Charleston 17 March 1832
Recorded in Miscellaneous Record
Book 5 No. page 100 and 107 Examined and Certified by
John N. [Banitlon?]
Deputy Secretary of State

[Written vertically:] J.W. Gray
Com: [Commissioner] in Eqy [Equity]
To
Miss S. M. Drayton

Bill of Sale of Chloe and Children

[End page 2]
